content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a function in Julia that should do the job:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    doc = Markdown.parse(md)
    code_blocks = Markdown.get_code_blocks(doc)
    julia_code_blocks = filter(x -> x.info.language == "julia", code_blocks)
    extracted_code = join([code.text for code in julia_code_blocks], "\n\n")
    return extracted_code
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown.jl` package to parse the markdown string, extract the code blocks, filter for Julia code blocks, and then join them together with a newline character. The function returns the extracted Julia code as a string. Please note that you need to have the `Markdown.jl` package installed in your Julia environment for this function to work. You can install it using the `Pkg` manager in Julia.
